Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw and label a fish accurately, showing detailed features such as fins, tails, and eyes.
The student can include and label other plants and animals that coexist in the same habitat, such as aquatic plants, snails, or other fish.
The student can label what the fish needs to survive, including water, food, and oxygen.
The student can illustrate and label how the fish and its environment form a system, indicating interactions like the fish eating algae or hiding in plants.

The student can demonstrate understanding of how the habitat provides resources like clean water and food, potentially noting different layers of the environment such as depths with different plant growth.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally miss less critical details, such as labeling every small element or providing in-depth labels for background elements *(student may focus on main components rather than extensive detail for everything)*.
